responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Missing input sanitization in src/test/resources/geth/test.sh
    analysis: |
      The file `src/test/resources/geth/test.sh` uses the environment variable `TEST_DURATION` in a shell command without sanitizing it. If a malicious actor can control the value of that environment variable, they may be able to inject arbitrary shell commands.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - src/test/resources/geth/test.sh
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Missing input sanitization in src/test/java/org/ethereum/beacon/discovery/TestUtil.java
    analysis: |
      The function `generateNode` in the file `src/test/java/org/ethereum/beacon/discovery/TestUtil.java` creates a node record without verifying the ECDSA signature. This means that the record could be signed by a malicious actor. A real-world exploit would rely on an attacker crafting a malicious node record and then finding a way to get that record into the node table.
    cwe: CWE-345
    function_names:
      - generateNode
    filenames:
      - src/test/java/org/ethereum/beacon/discovery/TestUtil.java
    classification: not promising
```

leads.headline: Missing input sanitization in src/test/resources/geth/test.sh
leads.analysis: The file src/test/resources/geth/test.sh uses the environment variable TEST_DURATION in a shell command without sanitizing it. If a malicious actor can control the value of that environment variable, they may be able to inject arbitrary shell commands.

leads.headline: Missing input sanitization in src/test/java/org/ethereum/beacon/discovery/TestUtil.java
leads.analysis: The function generateNode in the file src/test/java/org/ethereum/beacon/discovery/TestUtil.java creates a node record without verifying the ECDSA signature. This means that the record could be signed by a malicious actor. A real-world exploit would rely on an attacker crafting a malicious node record and then finding a way to get that record into the node table.
